Posts.Content: Hello Minky I had lumpectomy in September,results 2 weeks later were a mixed bag,clear margins and downgraded but the one lymph node taken showed a small amount of cancer.I was recommended to have node clearance and chemo.I decided against both,I have since had radiotherapy to the lymph nodes as well as my breast , I was told chemo would increase my chances of being cancer free in five years by only 3%, a percentage I am happy to take a risk with,but it is a very personal choice and one that requires a lot of thought. Hope you make the decision that is right for you. Helen
Posts.Title: To Chemo or not to chemo - that is the question?

Posts.Content: Hello Moleend I am sorry to read that you are undergoing treatment for a second time, I had a lumpectomy on 9th September and got results 2 weeks later 1.5cm,clear margins but the one lymph node taken showed small amount of cancer. I decided not to go for mode clearance or chemotherapy,and am now undergoing radiotherapy. My surgeon told me chemo would increase my chances of being cancer free in 10 years by 3%, I thought that was a small percentage and one I was happy to take a chance on, both my surgeon and breast care nurse were  happy with the decision however they were not so happy about me not going for node clearance .but In the end,as you say, the decision is ours alone. Wishing you all the best

Posts.Title: To Chemo or not to chemo - that is the question?

Posts.Content: Helllo fivejays i  was diagnosed 12 month ago,15mm tumour grade 2 pre surgery. I was not offered any scans just the chest xray and blood tests. I had a lumpectomy and the primary lymph node removed,the results showed the tumour downgraded to grade 1 but small amount of cancer cells in the lymph node. I had 15 sessions of radiotherapy and am now on hormone tablets for the next 5 years The waiting for surgery then the waiting for results really is the worst. I wish you and your fiancee all the best.

Posts.Title: WHY AXILLARY CLEARNCE ????

Posts.Content: Hello Nollie hope thing are getting a little better for you. I was diagnosed with  grade 2 breast cancer end of July ,sugery 9th September,lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy  went back for the results 2 weeks later, a mixed bag ,tumour downgraded to grade 1 but sentinel node had a small amount of cancer.I also have ponies.dog and assorted animals and as I am also main carer for my 5 year old grandson  who lives with me I refused further sugery.I have just started radiotherapy to my breast area and lymph nodes,4 days in and my shoulder/arm area aches ,only a little at the moment. but I fear will get worse I guess there is just no way to escape problems with mobility when the lymph nodes are involved. Posts.Title: Pain after lumpectomy & lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Hello Chris It was a very personal decision of mine not to go ahead with the node clearance I think the surgeon and breast care nurse were a little taken back and not impressed but it is up to the individual what if any treatment to undergo, that said they are the experts and their advice must be taken very seriously. It is scary and hard to take in ,you've just got your head around one course of treatment outlined to you and then it is changed.But as you say there are a lot of positive people and experiences on here and you are guaranteed suport,I have found it a great help and I am sure you will Helen
